security: Declassification of Warren Commission documents that refer to investigations could compromise intelligence sources and methods. The memo specifically recommends against declassifying CD-971, implying that its contents are sensitive.
summary: This is a memorandum regarding a letter from Sir Charles Spry (ASIO) recommending declassification of Warren Commission document CD-971, which refers to an investigation of anonymous telephone calls to the Canberra Embassy before and after President Kennedy's assassination. The memo recommends against declassification.
summary_one_paragraph: A memorandum from the Chief of the Far East Division to the Director of Central Intelligence, via the Deputy Director for Plans, concerning a letter from Sir Charles Spry, Director General of the Australian Security Intelligence Organization (ASIO), regarding the declassification of Warren Commission document CD-971. The document pertains to the investigation of anonymous telephone calls made to the Canberra Embassy before and after President Kennedy's assassination. The memo recommends against declassifying CD-971 in the foreseeable future, with CI Staff in agreement.
title: Letter for Director from Sir Charles Spry (ASIO)
